results.title: Cotton
results.brief_description: Shows hand and machine picking of cotton in the United States, followed by extraction of seeds by gin. Also explains how the cotton is baled, cleaned, fluffed, carded, spun into yarn, and finally woven into cloth.

results.title: Cosi Fan Tutte [Australian Opera]
results.brief_description: Mozart’s classic comedy is performed at the Victorian Arts Centre, March 28, 1990 as part of the ‘Esso night at the opera’ series. Cast includes Yvonne Kenny, David Hobson, Fiona Janes, Jeffrey Black, Rosamund Illing and John Pringle. In Italian with English sub-titles, music conducted by Peter Robinson.

results.title: Cortege of Eagles (TEFC)
results.brief_description: One of a group of modern dances created by Martha Graham. A creative ballet representing her mature creative work. The story is set in Ancient Troy at the time of its fall. When Hecuba, portrayed by Martha Graham, is faced with the inevitable consequence of the violent times, she herself is driven to terrible violence. Music composed and conducted by Eugene Lester: setting by Isamu Noguchi.

results.title: Correspondences: Víctor Erice and Abbas Kiarostami [exhibition]: archival material
results.brief_description:
“Correspondences” was an ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition, held 21 August 2008 - 2 November 2008.

See Exhibition activity record “Correspondences” (ID 35 ) for more information

Spanish director Víctor Erice’s small but acclaimed body of work has been widely acknowledged for its poetic and masterful storytelling. Iranian filmmaker Abbas Kiarostami is regarded as a master of contemporary world cinema, voted by many critics as the most important director of the nineties.

Although these two great filmmakers met face-to-face only once before this exhibition, they discovered powerful parallels in their interests and ideas. Featuring film, photography and new work created especially for the exhibition, Correspondences represents the long distance creative dialogue and intimate rapport that developed between Erice and Kiarostami.

results.title: Correction procedures
results.brief_description: Demonstrates and provides correction techniques used when assessing written work to provide immediate feedback on children’s progress. Shows how to diagnose incorrect responses by response type, how to recognize the type of error and three basic correction procedures.

results.title: Corporate Globalisation
results.creator_credit: Campbell Manderson, Pip Starr and SKA TV
results.brief_description: A look at the negative effects of corporate globalization has on the environment and human rights laws. Screened as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: Corot 1796-1875
results.brief_description: A survey of the works of Corot, a painter of joy and happiness who opened the door for the Impressionists by mingling the dream-life of Romanticism with the clean cool lines of the classical tradition.

results.title: Coronation day
results.creator_credit: Thorold Dickinson, United Nations Films and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description: Captures the coronation day of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II on the 2nd June, 1953. Shows the procession from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey, the coronation service, the procession back to the Palace and Her Majesty’s appearance on the balcony to watch the R.A.F. fly-past. Includes a glimpse of Sir Robert Menzies at the ceremony. Commentary by James McKechnie, script by Gerald Sanger.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thorold Dickinson, United Nations Films and United Nations. Office of Public Information

results.title: Coronation ceremony
results.creator_credit: Hindle Marriott Edgar, Central Office of Information and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: A film about the significance of the coronation ceremony. The opening sequences show, through old prints, pictures and tapestries, the history of the coronation ritual, and its gradual development to its present form. The film then gives, by means of black and white drawings, an artist’s impression of the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. Music composed by John Gardner and performed by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by John Hollingsworth. Story by Dermot Morrah, spoken by Leo Genn. Original drawings by James Gardiner and R. Jeffryes.
